name: HAT-P-36
scenarioDescription:
The HAT-P-36 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HAT-P-36 is a star with 1.03 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.04 times its radius. It is located 968.4550108 light years away from the solar system.

HAT-P-36 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HAT-P-36 system

HAT-P-36 b

HAT-P-36 b was discovered by the HATNet observatory using the Transit method. The mass of HAT-P-36 b is 587.41341 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HAT-P-36 b is 14.314 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HAT-P-36 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, HAT-P-36 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HAT-P-36, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by HATNet.
